location: A bedchamber in the castle: DESDEMONA in bed asleep

lines.text: Enter OTHELLO

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: It is the cause, it is the cause, my soul, Let me not name it to you, you chaste stars! It is the cause. Yet Ill not shed her blood Nor scar that whiter skin of hers than snow, And smooth as monumental alabaster. Yet she must die, else shell betray more men. Put out the light, and then put out the light: If I quench thee, thou flaming minister, I can again thy former light restore, Should I repent me: but once put out thy light, Thou cunningst pattern of excelling nature, I know not where is that Promethean heat That can thy light relume. When I have pluckd the rose, I cannot give it vital growth again. It must needs wither: Ill smell it on the tree. Ah balmy breath, that dost almost persuade Justice to break her sword! One more, one more. Be thus when thou art dead, and I will kill thee, And love thee after. One more, and this the last: So sweet was neer so fatal. I must weep, But they are cruel tears: this sorrows heavenly It strikes where it doth love. She wakes.
Kissing her

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Whos there Othello

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay. Desdemona.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Will you come to bed, my lord

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Have you prayd tonight, Desdemona

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Ay, my lord.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: If you bethink yourself of any crime Unreconciled as yet to heaven and grace, Solicit for it straight.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Alas, my lord, what do you mean by that

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Well, do it, and be brief I will walk by: I would not kill thy unprepared spirit No heaven forfend! I would not kill thy soul.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Talk you of killing

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay, I do.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Then heaven Have mercy on me!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Amen, with all my heart!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: If you say so, I hope you will not kill me.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Hum!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: And yet I fear you for you are fatal then When your eyes roll so: why I should fear I know not, Since guiltiness I know not but yet I feel I fear.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Think on thy sins.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: They are loves I bear to you.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay, and for that thou diest.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: That deaths unnatural that kills for loving. Alas, why gnaw you so your nether lip Some bloody passion shakes your very frame: These are portents but yet I hope, I hope, They do not point on me.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Peace, and be still!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: I will so. Whats the matter

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: That handkerchief which I so loved and gave thee Thou gavest to Cassio.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: No, by my life and soul! Send for the man, and ask him.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Sweet soul, take heed, Take heed of perjury thou art on thy deathbed.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Ay, but not yet to die.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Yes, presently: Therefore confess thee freely of thy sin For to deny each article with oath Cannot remove nor choke the strong conception That I do groan withal. Thou art to die.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Then Lord have mercy on me!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I say, amen.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: And have you mercy too! I never did Offend you in my life never loved Cassio But with such general warranty of heaven As I might love: I never gave him token.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: By heaven, I saw my handkerchief ins hand. O perjured woman! thou dost stone my heart, And makest me call what I intend to do A murder, which I thought a sacrifice: I saw the handkerchief.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: He found it then I never gave it him: send for him hither Let him confess a truth.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: He hath confessd.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: What, my lord

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: That he hath used thee.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: How unlawfully

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: He will not say so.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: No, his mouth is stoppd Honest Iago hath taen order fort.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: O! my fear interprets: what, is he dead

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Had all his hairs been lives, my great revenge Had stomach for them all.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Alas! he is betrayd and I undone.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Out, strumpet! weepst thou for him to my face

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: O, banish me, my lord, but kill me not!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Down, strumpet!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Kill me tomorrow: let me live tonight!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Nay, if you strive

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: But half an hour!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Being done, there is no pause.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: But while I say one prayer!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: It is too late.
He stifles her

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: [Within]  My lord , my lord! what, ho! my lord, my lord!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: What noise is this Not dead not yet quite dead I that am cruel am yet merciful I would not have thee linger in thy pain: So, so.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: [Within]  What, ho! my lord, my lord!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Whos there

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: [Within]  O, good my lord, I would speak a word with you!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Yes: tis Emilia. By and by. Shes dead. Tis like she comes to speak of Cassios death. The noise was here. Ha! no more moving Still as the grave. Shall she come in weret good I think she stirs again:no. Whats best to do If she come in, shell sure speak to my wife: My wife! my wife! what wife I have no wife. O insupportable! O heavy hour! Methinks it should be now a huge eclipse Of sun and moon, and that the affrighted globe Should yawn at alteration.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: [Within]  I do beseech you That I may speak with you, O, good my lord!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I had forgot thee: O, come in, Emilia Soft by and by. Let me the curtains draw. Where art thou Whats the matter with thee now
Unlocks the door
Enter EMILIA

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: O, my good lord, yonders foul murders done!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: What, now

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: But now, my lord.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: It is the very error of the moon She comes more nearer earth than she was wont, And makes men mad.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Cassio, my lord, hath killd a young Venetian Calld Roderigo.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Roderigo killd! And Cassio killd!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: No, Cassio is not killd.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Not Cassio killd! then murders out of tune, And sweet revenge grows harsh.

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: O, falsely, falsely murderd!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Alas, what cry is that

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: That! what

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Out, and alas! that was my ladys voice. Help! help, ho! help! O lady, speak again! Sweet Desdemona! O sweet mistress, speak!

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: A guiltless death I die.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: O, who hath done this deed

lines.speaker: desdemona
lines.text: Nobody I myself. Farewell Commend me to my kind lord: O, farewell!
Dies

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Why, how should she be murderd

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Alas, who knows

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: You heard her say herself, it was not I.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: She said so: I must needs report the truth.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Shes, like a liar, gone to burning hell: Twas I that killd her.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: O, the more angel she, And you the blacker devil!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: She turnd to folly, and she was a whore.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Thou dost belie her, and thou art a devil.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: She was false as water.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Thou art rash as fire, to say That she was false: O, she was heavenly true!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Cassio did top her ask thy husband else. O, I were damnd beneath all depth in hell, But that I did proceed upon just grounds To this extremity. Thy husband knew it all.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: My husband!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Thy husband.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: That she was false to wedlock

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay, with Cassio. Nay, had she been true, If heaven would make me such another world Of one entire and Perfect chrysolite, Ild not have sold her for it.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: My husband!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay, twas he that told me first: An honest man he is, and hates the slime That sticks on filthy deeds.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: My husband!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: What needs this iteration, woman I say thy husband.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: O mistress, villany hath made mocks with love, My husband say that she was false!

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: He, woman I say thy husband: dost understand the word My friend, thy husband, honest, honest Iago.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: If he say so, may his pernicious soul Rot half a grain a day! he lies to the heart: She was too fond of her most filthy bargain.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ha!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Do thy worst: This deed of thine is no more worthy heaven Than thou wast worthy her.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Peace, you were best.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Thou hast not half that power to do me harm As I have to be hurt. O gull! O dolt! As ignorant as dirt! thou hast done a deed I care not for thy sword Ill make thee known, Though I lost twenty lives.Help! help, ho! help! The Moor hath killd my mistress! Murder! murder!
Enter MONTANO, GRATIANO, IAGO, and others

lines.speaker: montano
lines.text: What is the matter How now, general!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: O, are you come, Iago you have done well, That men must lay their murders on your neck.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: What is the matter

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Disprove this villain, if thou best a man: He says thou toldst him that his wife was false: I know thou didst not, thourt not such a villain: Speak, for my heart is full.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I told him what I thought, and told no more Than what he found himself was apt and true.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: But did you ever tell him she was false

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I did.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: You told a lie, an odious, damned lie Upon my soul, a lie, a wicked lie. She false with Cassio!did you say with Cassio

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: With Cassio, mistress. Go to, charm your tongue.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: I will not charm my tongue I am bound to speak: My mistress here lies murderd in her bed,

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: O heavens forfend!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: And your reports have set the murder on.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Nay, stare not, masters: it is true, indeed.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Tis a strange truth.

lines.speaker: montano
lines.text: O monstrous act!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Villany, villany, villany! I think upont, I think: I smellt: O villany! I thought so then:Ill kill myself for grief: O villany, villany!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: What, are you mad I charge you, get you home.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Good gentlemen, let me have leave to speak: Tis proper I obey him, but not now. Perchance, Iago, I will neer go home.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O! O! O!
He falls on the bed

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Nay, lay thee down and roar For thou hast killd the sweetest innocent That eer did lift up eye.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: [Rising]  O, she was foul! I scarce did know you, uncle: there lies your niece, Whose breath, indeed, these hands have newly stoppd: I know this act shows horrible and grim.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Poor Desdemona! I am glad thy fathers dead: Thy match was mortal to him, and pure grief Shore his old thread in twain: did he live now, This sight would make him do a desperate turn, Yea, curse his better angel from his side, And fall to reprobation.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Tis pitiful but yet Iago knows That she with Cassio hath the act of shame A thousand times committed Cassio confessd it: And she did gratify his amorous works With that recognizance and pledge of love Which I first gave her I saw it in his hand: It was a handkerchief, an antique token My father gave my mother.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: O heaven! O heavenly powers!

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Come, hold your peace.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Twill out, twill out: I peace! No, I will speak as liberal as the north: Let heaven and men and devils, let them all, All, all, cry shame against me, yet Ill speak.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Be wise, and get you home.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: I will not.
IAGO offers to stab EMILIA

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Fie! Your sword upon a woman

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: O thou dull Moor! that handkerchief thou speakst of I found by fortune and did give my husband For often, with a solemn earnestness, More than indeed belongd to such a trifle, He beggd of me to steal it.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Villanous whore!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: She give it Cassio! no, alas! I found it, And I did givet my husband.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Filth, thou liest!

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: By heaven, I do not, I do not, gentlemen. O murderous coxcomb! what should such a fool Do with so good a woman

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Are there no stones in heaven But what serve for the thunderPrecious villain!
He runs at IAGO  IAGO, from behind, stabs EMILIA, and exit

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: The woman falls sure, he hath killd his wife.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: Ay, ay: O, lay me by my mistress side.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Hes gone, but his wifes killd.

lines.speaker: montano
lines.text: Tis a notorious villain. Take you this weapon, Which I have here recoverd from the Moor: Come, guard the door without let him not pass, But kill him rather. Ill after that same villain, For tis a damned slave.
Exeunt MONTANO and GRATIANO

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I am not valiant neither, But ever puny whipster gets my sword: But why should honour outlive honesty Let it go all.

lines.speaker: emilia
lines.text: What did thy song bode, lady Hark, canst thou hear me I will play the swan. And die in music. Willow, willow, willow, Moor, she was chaste she loved thee, cruel Moor So come my soul to bliss, as I speak true So speaking as I think, I die, I die.
Singing
Dies

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I have another weapon in this chamber It is a sword of Spain, the icebrooks temper: O, here it is. Uncle, I must come forth.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: [Within]  If thou attempt it, it will cost thee dear: Thou hast no weapon, and perforce must suffer.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Look in upon me then and speak with me, Or, naked as I am, I will assault thee.
Reenter GRATIANO

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: What is the matter

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Behold, I have a weapon A better never did itself sustain Upon a soldiers thigh: I have seen the day, That, with this little arm and this good sword, I have made my way through more impediments Than twenty times your stop: but, O vain boast! Who can control his fate tis not so now. Be not afraid, though you do see me weapond Here is my journeys end, here is my butt, And very seamark of my utmost sail. Do you go back dismayd tis a lost fear Man but a rush against Othellos breast, And he retires. Where should Othello go Now, how dost thou look now O illstarrd wench! Pale as thy smock! when we shall meet at compt, This look of thine will hurl my soul from heaven, And fiends will snatch at it. Cold, cold, my girl! Even like thy chastity. O cursed slave! Whip me, ye devils, From the possession of this heavenly sight! Blow me about in winds! roast me in sulphur! Wash me in steepdown gulfs of liquid fire! O Desdemona! Desdemona! dead! Oh! Oh! Oh!
Enter LODOVICO. MONTANO, CASSIO carried in a chair, and Officers with IAGO, prisoner

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Where is this rash and most unfortunate man

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Thats he that was Othello: here I am.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Where is that viper bring the villain forth.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I look down towards his feet but thats a fable. If that thou best a devil, I cannot kill thee.
Wounds IAGO

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Wrench his sword from him.

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: I bleed, sir but not killd.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I am not sorry neither: Ild have thee live For, in my sense, tis happiness to die.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: O thou Othello, thou wert once so good, Falln in the practise of a damned slave, What shall be said to thee

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Why, any thing: An honourable murderer, if you will For nought I did in hate, but all in honour.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: This wretch hath part confessd his villany: Did you and he consent in Cassios death

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Ay.

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Dear general, I never gave you cause.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I do believe it, and I ask your pardon. Will you, I pray, demand that demidevil Why he hath thus ensnared my soul and body

lines.speaker: iago
lines.text: Demand me nothing: what you know, you know: From this time forth I never will speak word.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: What, not to pray

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Torments will ope your lips.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Well, thou dost best.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Sir, you shall understand what hath befalln, Which, as I think, you know not. Here is a letter Found in the pocket of the slain Roderigo And here another: the one of them imports The death of Cassio to be undertook By Roderigo.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O villain!

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: Most heathenish and most gross!

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: Now heres another discontented paper, Found in his pocket too and this, it seems, Roderigo meant to have sent this damned villain But that belike Iago in the interim Came in and satisfied him.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O the pernicious caitiff! How came you, Cassio, by that handkerchief That was my wifes

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: I found it in my chamber: And he himself confessd but even now That there he droppd it for a special purpose Which wrought to his desire.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: O fool! fool! fool!

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: There is besides in Roderigos letter, How he upbraids Iago, that he made him Brave me upon the watch whereon it came That I was cast: and even but now he spake, After long seeming dead, Iago hurt him, Iago set him on.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: You must forsake this room, and go with us: Your power and your command is taken off, And Cassio rules in Cyprus. For this slave, If there be any cunning cruelty That can torment him much and hold him long, It shall be his. You shall close prisoner rest, Till that the nature of your fault be known To the Venetian state. Come, bring him away.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: Soft you a word or two before you go. I have done the state some service, and they knowt. No more of that. I pray you, in your letters, When you shall these unlucky deeds relate, Speak of me as I am nothing extenuate, Nor set down aught in malice: then must you speak Of one that loved not wisely but too well Of one not easily jealous, but being wrought Perplexd in the extreme of one whose hand, Like the base Indian, threw a pearl away Richer than all his tribe of one whose subdued eyes, Albeit unused to the melting mood, Drop tears as fast as the Arabian trees Their medicinal gum. Set you down this And say besides, that in Aleppo once, Where a malignant and a turband Turk Beat a Venetian and traduced the state, I took by the throat the circumcised dog, And smote him, thus.
Stabs himself

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: O bloody period!

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: All thats spoke is marrd.

lines.speaker: othello
lines.text: I kissd thee ere I killd thee: no way but this Killing myself, to die upon a kiss.
Falls on the bed, and dies

lines.speaker: cassio
lines.text: This did I fear, but thought he had no weapon For he was great of heart.

lines.speaker: lodovico
lines.text: [To IAGO]  O Spartan dog, More fell than anguish, hunger, or the sea! Look on the tragic loading of this bed This is thy work: the object poisons sight Let it be hid. Gratiano, keep the house, And seize upon the fortunes of the Moor, For they succeed on you. To you, lord governor, Remains the censure of this hellish villain The time, the place, the torture: O, enforce it! Myself will straight aboard: and to the state This heavy act with heavy heart relate. To sing a song that old was sung, From ashes ancient Gower is come Assuming mans infirmities, To glad your ear, and please your eyes. It hath been sung at festivals, On embereves and holyales And lords and ladies in their lives Have read it for restoratives: The purchase is to make men glorious Et bonum quo antiquius, eo melius. If you, born in these latter times, When wits more ripe, accept my rhymes. And that to hear an old man sing May to your wishes pleasure bring I life would wish, and that I might Waste it for you, like taperlight. This Antioch, then, Antiochus the Great Built up, this city, for his chiefest seat: The fairest in all Syria, I tell you what mine authors say: This king unto him took a fere, Who died and left a female heir, So buxom, blithe, and full of face, As heaven had lent her all his grace With whom the father liking took, And her to incest did provoke: Bad child worse father! to entice his own To evil should be done by none: But custom what they did begin Was with long use account no sin. The beauty of this sinful dame Made many princes thither frame, To seek her as a bedfellow, In marriagepleasures playfellow: Which to prevent he made a law, To keep her still, and men in awe, That whoso askd her for his wife, His riddle told not, lost his life: So for her many a wight did die, As yon grim looks do testify. What now ensues, to the judgment of your eye I give, my cause who best can justify.
Exeunt
PROLOGUE
Enter GOWER
Before the palace of Antioch
Exit
